info.title: Authologic Customer API
info.description:
The integration API for using with Authlogic Engine.                             

Authologic allows for simple and effective checking of the user's identity, and the use of API enables initiation by an external system
the verification process and the receipt of its results.

tags.name: Base
tags.description: 1. Base Methods needed for the verification process.

post.summary: Start a new user verification process
post.description:
Each process of getting data and confirming the identity of the user should start by calling this method.
The call initiates this process and returns information about the address to which the user should be redirected to
gathering the information requested from him.

**NOTE:** All these fields are marked optional. This is because all of these fields may have their default values set on the Authologic 
side when creating your account. If any value does not have a default setting you will get an error and you should either provide that value 
or report to Authologic to set the default one.

The query contains three groups of information:
 * general information such as:
   * **userKey**: User ID on your system
   * **strategy**: information about the identity checking strategy (usually the default value is sufficient)
   * **returnUrl**: URL to which the user should be redirected after the process is completed
   * **callbackUrl**: information about the return address to which the system will send the acquired information. If this information is not provided, Authologic assumes that the information will be downloaded by the client
 * **query**: query definition containing individual products provided by Authologic,
 * **hints**: data that is used for additional query configuration and optimization, consisting of information that is known to us
about the user (known) and data that we know, but are not sure (uncertain) - these are usually data declared by the user

The information contained in the query section is divided into specific products:
 * **identity** - fetch user information. This section is always required
    * **requireOneOf**: User information to be specified by Authologic. This is represented as set of sets and Authologic will try to fetch one of these
    * **optional**: User information that may be specified by Authologic when the information is available
 * **verify** - confirmation of the compliance of user data
    * **user**: information about user that should be verified 
 * **bankTransactions** - the process of retrieving information about transactions.
   * **type**: type of transaction - credit, debit or all
   * **flags**: Additional information on what to return
 * **aml** - check user on AML lists
   * **checks**: lists where the user should be checked
 * **auth** - user authentication product

get.summary: Retrieving up-to-date data as defined by the user identity verification process
get.description: **NOTE:** In practice, instead of this method you should use the callback mechanism described here. Returns information about how the identity validation process is performed for the given conversation ID. In the case of using the callback mechanism, the use of this method is optional - data needed are sent automatically when they change.

example.message: JSON body has an illegal format [Line: 10, Column: 12]: Unexpected character ('"' (code 34)): was expecting Array entries.
Conversation is unavailable due to retention policy.

delete.summary: Block access to the verification process
delete.description:
Creates an order to block the verification process. After completing such an order, the conversation will be switched to the 'EXPIRED' status. 
This means that the user entering such a verification process will be automatically redirected to the 'returnUrl' address. 
After the time specified by the retention settings, the conversation will be deleted.

get.summary: Obtaining the information needed to show the user the current page of the identity verification process
get.description:
Returns information about the page that should be rendered, all parameters needed to render the page and information which parameters should be
obtain from the user.

Conversation is unavailable due to retention policy.

get.summary: Retrieving a list of banking transactions related to the conversation
get.description:
Returns conversation-related banking transactions. Transactions only occur when the _bankTransactions_ section was defined when the conversation was created.
Transactions are available when the appropriate callback is received, or when the _bankTransactions_ status reaches _FINISHED_.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of items on the page

example.message: JSON body has an illegal format [Line: 10, Column: 12]: Unexpected character ('"' (code 34)): was expecting Array entries.
Conversation is unavailable due to retention policy.

get.summary: Retrieving statistics of downloaded banking transactions related to the conversation
get.description:
Returns statistics related to downloaded transactions. These statistics are returned for each account that has been shared as part of the conversation.
This information only occurs when the _bankTransactions_ section is defined when creating a conversation.
and are available when the appropriate callback is received, or when the _bankTransactions_ status reaches _FINISHED_.

example.message: JSON body has an illegal format [Line: 10, Column: 12]: Unexpected character ('"' (code 34)): was expecting Array entries.
Conversation is unavailable due to retention policy.

get.summary: Retrieving information on bank accounts related to the conversation
get.description:
Returns information about the accounts from which transactions have been downloaded.
This information occurs only when the _bankTransactions_ section was defined when creating a conversation.
and are available when the appropriate callback is received, or when the _bankTransactions_ status reaches _FINISHED_.

items.description: List of AML checks to perform

AMLProduct.description: Configures the required information about the AML checks.

AMLSubscription.description: The presence of the object enables recurring AML lists checking.

text.description: User's full address, not broken down into components. **Note:** This field has no format defined

challenge.description: Equivalent of a user's login in a given method.

AuthProduct.description: Configures the required information about auth product.

type.description:
Transaction type to be retrieved:
* CREDIT - credit
* DEBIT - debit
* ALL - all types

BankTransactionsProduct.description: Configures the required information about the user's banking transactions.

taxId.description: Tax identification number (in Poland: NIP) of the company

CompanyIds.description: Contains company-related identifiers if the current user is a legal entity

CompanyName.description: Contains information related to the identification of the company if the current user is a legal entity

CompanyUserInfo.description: Contains company-related information if the current user is a legal entity

emailOtp.description: User's email address confirmed with one time password

phoneOtp.description: User's phone confirmed with one time password

userKey.description: User ID on your system. This property is not used by the Authologic and is returned with the conversation status. If not given will be generated automatically.

returnUrl.description:
The address on your system where the user will be redirected after verifying his identity. If {conversationId} part was given,
it will be replaced with the conversation ID

callbackUrl.description: The address in your system to which information about the user will be sent. You can use placeholders: {conversationId}, {target} and {event}

layoutUrl.description:
The address on your system where the user will be redirected when Authologic need contact with user. This allows to define process look on your side.
            If {conversationId} part was given, it will be replaced with the conversation ID

strategy.description: Additional information on the user identity verification strategy

additionalProperties.description: Additional, optional settings depend on the selected strategy.

settings.description: Additional, optional settings depend on the selected strategy.

issueDate.description: Date of issue of the document

issueCountry.description: Country of issue of the document

type.description: Type od ID card, as it may be different depending on country

issueDate.description: Date of issue of the document

issueCountry.description: Country of issue of the document

requireOneOf.description:
Definition of the user information that have to be obtained. You can only define information to which you are entitled under the contract.
            The value is the list of field sets that should be specified. The system will assume that the conversation was successful if any of these sets can be determined.

issueCountry.description: Country of issue of the document

PersonUserInfo.description: Contains user-related information if the current user is a natural person

The type of user to be checked:
* PERSON - a person
* COMPANY - company

issueDate.description: Date of issue of the document

ConversationInfoResult.title: ConversationResult
ConversationInfoResult.description: The result of checking individual elements

reliability.description: Information about how closely the output matches the input data

details.description: detailed information about how closely given fields matches the input data

ConversationProductValidationResult.description: Additional information about the validations performed and their results

ConversationStatus.description:
Conversation state
* CREATED - conversation ready to be run
* IN_PROGRESS - data is being determined from the query
* PARTIAL - at least one product in the query has data ready for collection or finished processing
* FINISHED - query checks have been completed
* CANCELED - checking interrupted by the user
* EXPIRED - conversation is expired

ConversationStrategyInfo.title: ConversationInfo

method.description:
Verification method used.
* PSD2,
* TRANSFER,
* MOBYWATEL,
* MOJEID_PL,
* EDO_APP

* and many more

ConversationStrategyInfo.description: The information about activated strategy elements

ProductResultStatus.description:
Result status:
* IN_PROGRESS - checking in progress
* FINISHED - checking completed
* PARTIAL - checking completed but only some data could be identified
* FAILED - checking completed but no data could be determined

active.description: Information whether the subscription is active.

lastChanged.description: Date of the last change in the subscribed data.

SubscribedProduct.description: Information about the periodic checking of lists

field.description: The field to which the data relate

reliability.description: Information about how closely the field matches the input data

VerifyProductResultDetailInfo.description: detailed information about how closely given fields matches the input data

call.description: Endpoint responsible for processing the data from the current page

args.description: Data which should be obtained from the user

items.description: Data which should be obtained from the user

additionalProperties.description: Option parameters which can be used by the user

options.description: Option parameters which can be used by the user

async.description: The frequency of the asynchronous endpoint invocation, expressed in seconds

IdentityMetadata.description: Information about the metadata collected during the identification process

MediaSubtype.description:
Media subtype, for example type of the document. Subtype is empty, if the type is FACE.:
* ID_CARD - identified person's id card
* DRIVER_LICENSE - identified person's driver license
* PASSPORT - identified person's passport
* RESIDENCE_PERMIT - identified person's residence permit
* UTILITY_BILL - identified person's proof of address

MediaType.description:
Media type:
* DOCUMENT - identified person's document
* FACE - identified person's face
* REPORT - verification process report

MediaVariant.description:
Media variant, for example side of the document. Variant is empty, if the type is FACE.:
* FRONT - front side of the document
* BACK - back side of the document

MetadataInfo.description: Information about the list of available metadata collected during the identification process

accountId.description: Account number where transaction was registered.

amount.description: Transaction value in basic units - e.g. in cents

currency.description: Currency code in which the transaction took place

TransactionStatus.description:
Transaction status:
* BOOKED - transaction booked
* PENDING - transaction in progress
* SCHEDULED - Transaction scheduled in the future

TransactionType.description:
Transaction Type / Direction:
* CREDIT - account crediting
* DEBIT - debiting the account

more.description: Information whether there are more pages available

dateFirst.description: Date of the first transaction in the range

dateLast.description: Date of the last transaction in the range

numberOfCreditTransactions.description: The number of credit transactions of the account. The value will be available if you selected all transactions or credit transactions.

numberOfDebitTransactions.description: Number of account debit transactions. The value will be available if you selected all transactions or debit transactions.

avgCreditPerMonth.description: Average value of credit transactions per month, presented in basic units - e.g. in cents. The value will be available if the analyzed period is greater than 60 days and if credit transactions or all of them were selected when creating the conversation.

avgDebitPerMonth.description: Average value of credit transactions per month, presented in basic units - e.g. in cents. The value will be available if the analyzed period is greater than 60 days and if credit transactions or all of them were selected when creating the conversation.

avgCredit.description: Average value of the account's credit transactions, presented in basic units - e.g. in cents. The value will be available if you selected all transactions or credit transactions.

avgDebit.description: Average value of the account's debit transactions, presented in basic units - e.g. in cents. The value will be available if you selected all transactions or debit transactions.

maxCredit.description: Maximum value of the account credit transaction, presented in basic units - e.g. in cents. The value will be available if you selected or all credit transactions when creating the conversation.

maxDebit.description: Maximum value of the account debit transaction, presented in basic units - e.g. in cents. The value will be available if you selected all transactions or debit transactions.

TransactionStatistics.description: Information about transaction statistics for a given account

dateFrom.description: The starting date of the search criteria or the date of the first transaction for all accounts if the criteria was empty

dateTo.description: End date of the search criteria or the last transaction date for all accounts if the criteria was empty

items.description: List of transaction statistics for each account separately

date.description: The date for which the data is valid

balance.description: Account balance in basic units - e.g. in cents

accountId.description: Unique account identifier. All transactions from one account have the same ID

activationDate.description: The date when the account was opened or the date of the oldest transaction found

Account.description: Information about transactions for a given account

items.description: List of transaction information for each account

more.description: Information whether there are more pages available
